properties.areaDesc: St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands; Culebra
properties.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 18 at 6:39PM AST until January 19 at 6:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to
8 feet, increasing to 12 to 17 feet late tonight. For the High
Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the
Coastal Flood Advisory, salt-water intrusion over local roads
and low- lying areas near beaches causing minor flooding,
particularly at high tide.

* WHERE...Culebra, St. Thomas, St. John, and Adjacent Islands.

* WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 PM AST Monday. For
the High Rip Current Risk, through late Monday night. For the
Coastal Flood Advisory, until 6 PM AST Sunday. The next high
tide for St. Thomas is between 3-5 AM Sunday, and 5-7 AM Sunday in
Culebra.

* IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and
localized beach erosion. High surf will wash over nearby rocks
and jetties. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away
from shore into deeper water. During high tide, coastal
flooding is possible with water potentially covering streets and
low- lying areas.
properties.instruction:
If travel along coastal routes is required, allow extra time as
some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or
through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to
protect flood-prone property.

Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to
dangerous surf conditions.

Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and
float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a
direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the
shore and call or wave for help.

NWSheadline: HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST SUNDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST MONDAY
